raw_comment:
I notice the the legacy applicants consistently have a higher chance of being accepted, especially with parents of higher income.
I wonder why colleges automatically take someone with parents of higher income, what if a student with parents of lower income may be a better fit for the school? Legacy does not mean that the generations are as equally academic as the ones before. 
This relates to my community because Dallas is a higher income community with many children that hope to pursue academics in college. These kids will be very privileged in their choices of college schooling.
ace_sentences: Legacy applicants consistently have a higher chance of being accepted.
Legacy applicants often have parents with a higher income.
I wonder why a college automatically accepts a person who has parents with a higher income.
A student can have parents with a lower income.
A student who has parents with a lower income may be a better fit for a school than a student who has parents with a higher income.
If a person is a legacy applicant then it does not mean that this person is as academic as a previous generation.
This situation relates to my community.
Many children in Dallas hope to pursue academics in college.
These children will be very privileged in their choices of colleges.
